snippet: Russia’s move to seize control of Ukraine’s Crimean Peninsula on Saturday led Ukraine to call up its military reserves on Sunday and warn Moscow against further incursions.
abstract: Ukraine calls up its military reserves and warns Moscow against further incursions as Western powers scramble to find a response to Russia's move to seize control of Ukraine's Crimean Peninsula; Ukrainian government threatens war if Russia sends troops further into Ukraine.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Simferopol, and David M. Herszenhorn from Kiev, Ukraine. Reporting was contributed by Noah Sneider and Patrick Reevell from Simferopol; Andrew Higgins from Sevastopol, Ukraine; Andrew Roth from Moscow; Somini Sengupta from the United Nations; and Michael R. Gordon and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s move to seize control of Ukraine’s Crimean Peninsula on Saturday led Ukraine to call up its military reserves on Sunday and warn Moscow against further incursions.

headline.sub: Western Powers Scramble to Respond to Growing Crisis
headline.main: Ukraine Mobilizes Reserve Troops, Threatening War
headline.print_headline: Kremlin Deploys Military to Seize Crimea
